wikipedia_page.main: Dr William Craig FRSE FRCSE (28 March 1832 – 3 February 1922) was a Scottish surgeon and botanist. He was an expert on jaborandi, an appetite suppressant. His collections and studies were largely focussed upon Perthshire in central Scotland.

response: *William Craig Brownlee, Clergyman, author and Professor of Languages at Rutgers University
*William Craig, Surgeon and botanist, President of the Edinburgh Botanical Society and Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh
*William Craig (philosopher) (1918–2016), professor of philosophy at the University of California, Berkeley
*William Craig (Northern Ireland politician) (1924–2011), Northern Ireland politician
*William Craig (Secret Service) (1855–1902), United States Secret Service member

link_mentions.page: Edinburgh College of Medicine for Women
response: *William Craig FRSE, FRCSEd (Therapeutics) became better known as a botanist in later life.
